intro: Oxytropis arctica subsp. taimyrensis, commonly known as Arctic locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Oxytropis arctica subsp. taimyrensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various Arctic fauna.
